dlgPart.npc_text: “Report, Centurion,” says Carrinas when you approach.

dlgAnsw.text: Tell him what you’ve been up to.
“Paullus made a deal with Gaelius. Meru’s fucked.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“I wonder what Paullus is up to. Blue steel is as good of a reason as any to get involved with Meru, but I have a feeling that there is more to it than meets the eye. Meru needs an escort for a reason – he expects trouble. Trouble means Gaelius. The only question is how does Paullus benefit from all this.
“Let’s find it. Go to Ganezzar and do what Meru asks, but be careful and watch your back.”
“You handled Gaelius well but it’s far from over. Return to Maadoran and report to Pavola if you haven’t already.”
“I knew it wasn’t over. Go to the pass without delay and stay there until the job is done. Bass can use a <man/woman> like you.”
“I didn’t think that Paullus had it in him,” Carrinas says slowly. “It changes a lot of things.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You know what they say about changes. The more things change, the more they stay the same.”
“You have enough men to break the siege and hold the town if Gaelius comes a-knocking. You want your chance – take it.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Chance?” asks Carrinas, frowning. “I wanted to change things. Paullus could sit and wait for decades, I couldn’t. That’s why I did all this,” he gestures around him.
“But now ... now that Paullus is doing something, sabotaging his plans would be treason. You’ve served me well, so I’ll pretend that you came to me not to incite a rebellion, but to ask for advice.
“My advice is simple: you have your orders, soldier. Quit your scheming and carry them out. Dismissed!”
“Chance?” asks Carrinas, frowning. “I wanted to change things. Paullus could sit and wait for decades, I couldn’t. That’s why I did all this,” he gestures around him.

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]“You've gone too far to stop now. You have Antidas and his men. If you break the siege, you'll have two Noble Houses backing you up. Meru can’t defend himself but his power is very ... unconventional and it grows daily. Strengthen him and share that power. Hesitate and stay in Teron forever.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]“No,” Carrinas says firmly. “You’ve served me well, so I’ll pretend that you came to me not to incite a rebellion, but to ask for advice.
“My advice is simple: you have your orders, soldier. Quit your scheming and carry them out. Dismissed!”
[success]“I’m not going to fight Paullus. We have our differences but he isn’t my enemy.”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]“You won’t have to fight him. Paullus sided with Gaelius because Meru is too weak. He didn’t have another choice, but you can change that. Break the siege and Paullus will side with you.”
[streetwise]“I’m not suggesting attacking our brothers-in-arms. Take out the Aurelian forces and let Paullus decide which side he wants to be on. If he isn’t your enemy, he’ll stand with you.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]“We aren’t ready yet. You’re asking me to take another town when we haven’t even finished fortifying Teron.”
[success]“Alright,” nods Carrinas. “I’ll leave just enough men to hold the walls against raiders and take my legion to Ganezzar. If they’re expecting Paullus, we can use it to our advantage.”
